[[Image:Acorn Hall Pin.png|thumb|200px|right|A map showing the location of Acorn Hall on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''Acorn Hall''' is a castle in the [[Riverlands]], the region controlled by [[House Tully]] of [[Riverrun]]. The castle is located south east of [[Riverrun]], near the hill [[High Heart]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/twins/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, The Twins entry]</ref><ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/harrenhall/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, Harrenhal entry]</ref> It is the seat of [[House Smallwood]].<ref>[http://www.hbogo.com/?camp=GoG829#series/video&assetID=GOROSTGP32079?videoMode=embeddedVideo?showSpecialFeatures=true/ ]</ref>
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels Acorn Hall is the seat of House Smallwood, a minor House sworn to House Vance of Wayfarer's Rest. It is an oaken keep surrounded by stone curtain walls.
sections.History:
===Season 1===
[[Pypar]] explains to [[Jon Snow]] and [[Samwell Tarly]] that the real reason he was sent to the [[Night's Watch]] is because he was performing as a singer at Acorn Hall when some lord touched his leg and asked to see his cock. Pyp refused, so the lord grew angry and falsely accused Pyp of attempting to steal the silverware, after which he was arrested and sent to the Night's Watch. When Sam points out that Pyp had earlier said that he was arrested for stealing a wheel of cheese to feed his starving younger sister, he explains that this is just a lie he came up with because the real reason was embarrassing.<ref>"[[You Win or You Die]]"</ref>
